title: Prohibits the use, with exceptions, of an electronic entry card or device as a mechanism for resident or resident's guest to enter or exit a residential building
summary: Prohibits the use, with exceptions, of an electronic entry card or device as a mechanism for resident or resident's guest to enter or exit a residential building; not applicable if all lease-holding tenants affirmatively consent to such use in writing.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3514

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. KAVANAGH, O'DONNELL, GLICK, ENGLEBRIGHT, HOOPER,
         PHEFFER, NOLAN, N. RIVERA, GOTTFRIED, WRIGHT -- Multi-Sponsored by  --
         M. of A. McENENY -- read once and referred to the Committee on Cities

       AN  ACT  to  amend the general city law, in relation to electronic entry
         cards which register personal identifying information

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  general  city law is amended by adding a new section
    2  18-e to read as follows:
    3    S 18-E. ELECTRONIC ENTRY CARDS OR DEVICES. AN ELECTRONIC ENTRY CARD OR
    4  DEVICE WHICH CONTAINS, REGISTERS OR RECORDS PERSONAL IDENTIFYING  INFOR-
    5  MATION  SHALL  BE  PROHIBITED  FROM USE AS A MECHANISM FOR A RESIDENT OR
    6  RESIDENT'S GUEST TO ENTER OR EXIT  A  RESIDENTIAL  BUILDING  UNLESS  ALL
    7  LEASE-HOLDING  RESIDENTS  AFFIRMATIVELY  CONSENT TO SUCH USE IN WRITING.
    8  FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, PERSONAL IDENTIFYING INFORMATION SHALL
    9  INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, A PHOTOGRAPH,  NAME,  ADDRESS,  UNIT  OR
   10  APARTMENT NUMBER, TIME OF ENTRANCE AND/OR EXIT, AND A RESIDENTIAL BUILD-
   11  ING SHALL MEAN AN APARTMENT HOUSE.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00945-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the general city law, in relation to electronic entry cards which register personal identifying information
